definition: plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: Before long the pla suppressed the armed rebellion in shanna n where the rebels had been entrenched for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 以后又平息了叛乱分子长期盘踞的山南地区的叛乱。

sentences.english: Before long, the PLA suppressed the armed rebellion in Shannan, where the rebels had been entrenched for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 以后又平息了叛乱分子长期盘踞的山南地区的叛乱。

sentences.english: Something like a hotel reception desk now occupied one end of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 很像旅馆前台的桌子有模有样的盘踞在大厅。

sentences.english: The islands themselves hold the small military camps set up Hades advancing army.
sentences.chinese: 在这些岛屿上盘踞着一些小规模的地狱军队营地。

sentences.english: Thirteen eagle on horseback to the old demons killing occupy the top of the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 十三鹰策马杀至老魔盘踞的华山之巅。

sentences.english: The bats and owlets builders in the roof!
sentences.chinese: 是蝙蝠和夜莺的窠巢盘踞在顶梁。

sentences.english: Doctors fear that dangerous bacteria may become entrenched in hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心危险的细菌有可能盘踞医院。

definition: variant of 盤踞|盘踞[pan2 ju4]
to roam all over the place/to go into every nook and corner/to infiltrate/(of criminals, enemies etc) to be on the run/to flee and try to hide
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
stronghold/defended military base/base for operations/strategic point/foothold/(market) presence
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
